properties.name: Space Shooter
properties.description: In this retro space shooter, kill enemies and boss to complete the level.

events.comment: Spaceship
Mech
Transformation animation
Collision
Damages
Scrolling
The camera an the player must be shifted at the same time to avoid flickering.
At the beginning, make all enemies inactive
Then, check if enemies are entering on the screen:
Activate enemies on screen
Damages, collision, death
Activate only items that are on the screen
Damages (on the arms when they are idle/firing, and on the body only when arms are retracted or broken)
Animations and attacks pattern
Death

eventsBasedObjects.description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteContinuousBar

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
description: Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
It handles:
- cooldown between shots
- firing multiple bullets at a time
- ammo management
- overheat
[A simplified version](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet) of the top-down twin-stick shooter example allows to check it out.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Increase heat (if needed)
Check if this caused overheat
Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

events.name: Reduce heat level (based on cooling rate)

eventsFunctions.description:
Fire bullets toward a position.

Each bullet is assigned variables for advanced object picking
- __FireBullet.BulletID, Unique number for every bullet created
- __FireBullet.BatchID, Unique number for all bullets created in the same frame
- __FireBullet.BatchOrderID, Unique number for each bullet in the same batch. Can be used to identify the position in the firing arc.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ with speed _PARAM7_ px/s

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second

- __FireBullet.BatchOrderID, Unique number for each bullet in the same batch. Can be used to identify the position in the firing arc.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.
description: Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.
Damage calculations are performed in this order:
Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health
How to use:
- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use Apply damage to an object
- To heal health, use Heal object action
- To activate the shield, use Activate shield action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
Tips:
- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the Blink extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the Is just damaged or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects
Health properties:
- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
Shield properties:
- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

events.comment: Health
Correct any values above maximum limits
Shield
Correct any values above maximum limits

events.name: Remove shield points if shield expired

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: StayOnScreen

parameters: min(max(Object.X(), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 + Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginLeft()), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Width() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginRight())

min(max(Object.Y(), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2+ Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginTop()), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Height() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginBottom())

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovement

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. Make sure that your object has two animations called "Left" and "TurnLeft".
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: BackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: Move the object to the left or right
If the distance "DistanceX" is reached, turn the object
At the end of the turn, go back to moving to th left (or right if flipped)

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed on X axis, in pixels per second
propertyDescriptors.name: SpeedX

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance traveled on X axis, in pixels
propertyDescriptors.name: DistanceX

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

propertyDescriptors.label: Amplitude of the movement on X axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: AmplitudeX

propertyDescriptors.label: Amplitude of the movement on Y axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: AmplitudeY

eventsFunctions.description: Vibrate the camera randomly around a position
eventsFunctions.fullName: Vibrate the camera around a position
eventsFunctions.name: VibrateCameraAroundPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Vibrate the camera around _PARAM1_;_PARAM2_ with amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis at frequency _PARAM5_hz (layer: _PARAM6_)

parameters.description: X position where to set the camera
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position where to set the camera
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Amplitude of the shaking on X axis, in pixels
parameters.name: XAmplitude

parameters.description: Amplitude of the shaking on Y axis, in pixels
parameters.name: YAmplitude

eventsFunctions.description: Handle the player object movements, by checking the touch position or the keys pressed
eventsFunctions.name: HandlePlayerMovement
eventsFunctions.sentence: Handle the movements of _PARAM1_ (using touch, if not touching _PARAM3_, or keyboard keys)

events.comment: Moving with touch/mouse
Moving with keyboard (you can customize controls here)

parameters.description: Top-down movement behavior of this object
parameters.name: TopDownMovement

parameters.description: Object that are buttons, that should not result in having the player moved
parameters.name: ChangeButton

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the player is pressing the fire button
eventsFunctions.name: ShouldFire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Player is pressing fire button (using touch or keyboard)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the player is pressing the transform key, or touching the "Change" button on screen.
eventsFunctions.name: ShouldTransform
eventsFunctions.sentence: The player is pressing the transform key (or touching _PARAM1_)

parameters.description: The object to touch to trigger transformation
parameters.name: ChangeButton

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the player is moving up
eventsFunctions.name: GoingUp

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the player is moving down
eventsFunctions.name: GoingDown
